text: A lion entered the yard of a farmer, and he, wanting to take him, closed the door. The lion, seeing that he could not get out, began to devour the lambs first, and then the oxen. Then the farmer, fearing for his own life, opened the door. And the lion went away; and the wife of the farmer, when she heard him murmur, said to him, Thou hast what thou soughtst; why hast thou bound a beast that thou shouldest keep away? If you compete with the powerful, prepare well or you will be badly wounded.
title: El león apresado por el labrador
author: nan Esopo
